name: Lower Drylands
role_in_state: provisioner of salted goods and caravan staging for maritime trade
culture_adjustments: stronger clan-land tenure than port-based kinship
rituals emphasize water-conservation and land-ancestors over open-sea rites
contract etiquette more barter- and caravan-focused than shipboard jargon
ceremonial seamanship exists but adapted to overland caravan launches
constraints: scarce fresh water restricts heavy industry and ritual water-uses
ritual magic requires imported reagents and specialized labor
no high-pressure combustion industry permitted by state norms
notes: seasonal workforce shifts between salterns and coastal ports
supplies salted provisions and seasoned timber to State_9 shipyards
local augury stations coordinate with maritime guides but cannot replace charts
